alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 2:44PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 315 PM MDT... At 243 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles east of Kit Carson, or 18 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, including the following locations... Firstview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
